snippet: A Brookings Institution study presents what it calls “an emerging portrait” of applicants under a year-old program that is one of President Obama’s signature immigration initiatives.
abstract: Brookings Institution study presents what group calls 'an emerging portrait' of young immigrants who have sought temporary reprieve from deportation under year-old program that is one of Pres Obama's signature immigration initiatives; findings may boost arguments from immigration advocates that many young immigrants should be granted expedited path to legal status because they were brought to United States at young age and are essentially American.
lead_paragraph: A Brookings Institution study presents what it calls “an emerging portrait” of applicants under a year-old program that is one of President Obama’s signature immigration initiatives.

headline.main: Study Offers a Picture of Young Immigrants Seeking a Reprieve From Deportation
headline.print_headline: Study Offers a Picture of Young Immigrants Seeking a Reprieve From Deportation
